title: Data Analyst
body:
Salary negotiable









Bexhill-on-Sea



, East Sussex




Permanent, full-time







                        Apply on employer's website
                    


 Hastings Direct, Data AnalystAre you commercially and analytically minded and looking to play a fundamental role in an exciting and evolving product?The Telematics team (based in our Bexhill HQ) is a forward-thinking team looking to revolutionize and shape the way we look at insurance in the future. This exciting new role would place you in the heart of the analytical & pricing team where you can influence  and drive strategic initiatives central to achieving our group objectives.A STEM degree and experience is advantageous but, if you have strong baseline skills in software such as Excel and a keen desire to learn, the supportive Telematics team will invest in your development. You will learn from the experts and be able to carve out  your career in a role that will give you exposure to some key senior partners and departments crucial to the success of our business.The RoleThe purpose of this role is to act as the key point of contact for the Telematics team to complete analysis in a variety of areas to inform both commercial and customer outcomes using key analysis.Your remit will include the following;  Building and delivering robust MI and BI reporting to provide oversight to key stakeholders to support trading and business decisions, with a view of identifying key trends, spotting trading anomalies and working with the data analytics & pricing manager  to take action to support performanceKey point of contact for technical, data and analytical requests to support wider business functions in achieving the wider group's objectivesEnd-to-end responsibility for the implementation and testing of retail pricing changes and practices, providing detailed impact analysis for company and customerConduct ad hoc analysis, creating & testing various hypotheses raised by the teamOwnership of key business processes ensuring delivery within agreed timeframes, with an eye to improve the team's productivity via automated solutions Required experience  Highly analytical; able to clean, scrutinize and interrogate high volumes of complex data and translate into meaningful reports, insights and high level management informationHave a passion for data quality and integrity, cleansing and querying data from structured databasesAdvanced skills in the use of MS office applicationsGood communication and presentation skills (both verbal and written)Keen eye for detailPro-active approach to driving changeConfidence to express opinions and challenge othersEducated to A level in a numerical field (minimum) Desirable  Advantageous to have a BSc/MSc in Statistics / Computer Science / Physics / Operational Research / Engineering / Maths or other quantitative fieldExperience working with analytical, statistical & data manipulation packages (e.g. SQL, R, Python etc.)Strong knowledge of Insurance market & competitorsProven research skills, including ability to formulate hypotheses and identify ways to prove or disprove these with targeted testsExperience delivering commercial targets Personal attributes  As a growing business, your role can really help make an impact on both the development and delivery of this function - it will be exciting, busy, varied and challenging so a roll sleeves up, hands-on approach is an absolute must.Natural problem solver who communicates effectively to all stakeholders.This is a dynamic, fast paced working environment - candidates should be comfortable working within that setting and demonstrate a proactive working style.Great attention to detail - systematic approach to managing your workload.Embraces opportunities to develop and learn - shows a great level of self-awareness and drive. Benefits for youPlease find some of the great benefits we offer here at Hastings Direct;  Competitive basic salary which we will share with you upon shortlisting, but do feel free to email the Recruitment team for more details in advance of your application - Flexible working opportunities working 1-2 days a week from homeUp to 5% bonus earning potential25 days holidayCompetitive pensionFlexible benefits - buy or sell holidays, opt in dental and healthcare cash plansDiscounted Hastings Direct productsA test and learn culture Hastings Group is an equal opportunities employer which means we treat people fairly. We welcome applications from all suitably skilled persons regardless of their gender, age, race, disability, ethnic background, religion/belief, sexual orientation, gender  reassignment or marital/family status. Please also note that we have a thorough referencing process, which includes credit and criminal record checks. 


Required skills

SQL
Statistics
VBA
R

title: Data Analyst
body:
£30,000 - £50,000 per annum















Central London



, London




Permanent, full-time







                        Apply now
                    


 DATA ANALYST - 30,000-50,000 + BENEFITS, LONDON My client is an established consulting firm who are looking for numerical, analytical Data Analysts to join their market-leading data analytics advisory practice delivering professional services to a range of financial institutions, including investment  banks, hedge funds and central banks, and energy, retail, telecoms, utilities and government clients.  This would be a great role for if you are looking to work on complex data analytics problems in a big data environment. You will be working on proactive fraud prevention management, anti-money laundering, concept clustering, social network analysis, sentiment  analysis, data visualization and dashboarding, developing their centres of excellence internally and their overall service offerings.  This firm is well-known for providing employees with opportunity to expand their experience, knowledge, and their skills in the data analytics, fraud investigations, forensic data analytics, and the Big Data space. You will also develop consulting skills  and will work with clients, fraud investigators, internal and external auditors, lawyers and regulatory authorities. They have a flexible culture, with inclusive values, and lots of development opportunities.  Please note for all roles, the skills which you have gained that could be applied to these roles are more important than the type of data you have worked with. For the junior roles, you do NOT need any experience in Forensic / Fraud Data Analytics, towards the more Senior End it would be preferential to have some industry expertise but it is not essential.  At all levels you must have experience in one or more of the following:  Data analysis, data manipulation and an understanding of common data quality problemsAnalytical expertise: SAS; SPSS; R; SAP HANAData management/engineering skills: SQL; ETL; PythonBig data tools: Hadoop; HIVE; PIGVisualisation skills: Qlikview; Tableau; D3 Essential skills:   It is essential you have a minimum of a Degree in a technical or analytical based subject (e.g. Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Engineering) from a top-tier University with good A Levels (or equivalent)  Depending on experience you will need to show experience of, or the ability to develop skills in the following:  Show great skill in stakeholder and project managementBe proactive, diligent and interested in the subject matter; you won’t be the sort of person who is always waiting for the next stage of the process: you will be inquisitive and proactiveShow great attention to detailDesire to work in a leading consulting firm (with this comes a structured career path, regular appraisals, with specific KPIs you come up with in order to further your own career) In-depth analysis of complex dataExperience in writing reports and presentations to explain the findingsAbility to come up with solutions to complex problemsAbility to manage time, prioritise tasks and work independentlyExcellent communication skills, both written and oral This is a great place to develop a career, as the organisation has an excellent reputation on a global scale, and a wonderful client roster. You will have the opportunity to work with subject matter experts and to learn new disciplines as you grow with the  firm. The successful candidates will perform a client delivery focused role, which typically involves the management, manipulation and analysis of data and transformations using innovative techniques to leverage insight into a client’s structured and unstructured  data, to provide answers to complex analytical problems. This team are commited to being the best at what they do.  There is a need for great people with strong analytics knowledge, as more emphasis is being put on not only understanding the issues companies are facing with their data, but how they can better leverage their data and use it to mitigate risk and fraud.  Benefits include: a great salary, healthcare, gym, pension plan, mobile phone, and laptop.

title: Data Analyst
body:
Competitive salary









London



, South East England




Permanent, full-time







                        Apply now
                    


 As a Data Analyst at Sagacity Solutions, you will often work on client sites in multi-disciplinary project teams and under-take client work. You will be passionate and committed to seeing transformational change projects and programmes through to successful  completion as time efficiently as possible for the ultimate benefit of both our clients’ and the Sagacity teams. Tasks will include: Data Sourcing  Define required datasets for analysisObtain data though available channels o Work with Sagacity developers or client BI / technical teams o Use client management information systems (e.g. Hyperion / Business Objects etc.) o Query directly from source tables / databases o Build from existing flat files / SharePoint repositories  Ensure secure transfer and storage of client dataLoad and transform / manipulate data as required to get into a suitable format for analysisValidate data quality or fix isolated issues as required Analysis & Modelling  Data analysis and identification of key and emerging trendsInvestigate key drivers and draw relationships between different items of informationUndertake business casing and scenario modellingUse statistical techniques where appropriate to test and model predictive relationshipsIdentify actionable insight from datasets in response to business questions Reporting  Design and streamline processes to obtain and prepare regular and ad-hoc reportingUtilise data visualisation software (e.g. Tableau) as appropriateDesign and prepare management information packs Presentation & communication  Work with Sagacity team members to discuss and develop findingsPrepare material and communicate to summarise findings, using non-technical language as required by audienceUse commercial understanding & awareness to present findings, key trends, issues and potential solutions in context Requirements Competencies:  Our Data Analysts have excellent communication, planning, prioritisation and organisational skills. They demonstrate strong commercial awareness, which promotes and protects the interests of both Sagacity and our clients alike. Key competencies and requirements  include:  Excellent planning and reportingClear and transparent communicationHigh level attention to detailClient relationship managementLogical and structured approachCritical thinking and problem solvingDecision-makingInfluencing, leading, negotiatingTeam playerConflict managementAdaptabilityStress tolerancePresentable, professional, punctualResponsibleAbility to travel throughout the UK to client site Education, Training, Skills & Experience You will have strong problem solving and quantitative skills, as well as a demonstrable ability to articulate complex and inter-connected concepts clearly. You will have good commercial awareness and the ability to understand and analyse key business drivers,  and the impact they have, and make recommendations for change, for example, to mitigate risk or enhance business performance for a business. You will have the ability to work to very tight deadlines, but also to manage your own time and deliverables whilst working on large projects. The ability to effectively prioritise and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment and to meet fixed deadlines  is essential. Excellent communication skills are also required as you will liaise with senior professionals both within Sagacity and with our clients. In the role, you will initiate and manage the regular review and interpretation of information and data. You will manipulate large amounts of data in Excel and use extraction and reporting tools. You will manage the delivery, commercial analysis and presentation  of the data to the client. You will ideally be educated to degree level in a numerate subject, and with strong A-levels (in mathematical/ scientific based subjects) and will have proven experience in undertaking detailed analysis in a variety of relevant industries and the ability  to operate effectively in unfamiliar environments, remaining calm under pressure and agile in approach. In order to be successful in this role, you should be able to demonstrate the following:  Ability to write succinctly and clearlyExperience of financial planning, analysis and scenario modellingComfort in building business casesAgility - able to turn hand to a problem, resourcefulProblem solving & resourcefulness and ability to find an innovative approach to a problemAbility to communicate findings of complex analysis to non-financial and non-technical stakeholdersSelf-starting - ability to manage and prioritise your own workloadDesire to learn and improve skills Desired Skills & Experience:  Commercial experience in relevant industries (Telcoms, Banking, Utilities)Excellence in MS Excel including advanced Pivot tablesExperience of MS Access and other database toolsExperience of using to SQL to generate basic queries (more advance SQL skills beneficial)Experience of business information solutions such as Business Objects or Hyperion beneficialExperience of data visualisation tools such as QlikView / Tableau/MS PowerView beneficial 


Required skills

Analytical Skills
Data Analysis
Management
Project Management
Stakeholder Management

A fantastic opportunity has become available for a Data Analyst to join a leading technical consultancy firm. This firm provides independent Airport IT and Baggage Handling System Consultancy services to some of the UK’s biggest airports. Based in Slough,  Berkshire, the successful Data Analyst will earn a competitive salary, varying dependant upon experience.When it comes to the aviation industry, this consultancy service is up there with the best. They deal with the delivery, management and engineering of large-scale Airport projects, principally working in the baggage handling and cargo environment. They are  known for the quality of their service and attribute their success to the dedicated and talented staff that work there. The successful Data Analyst will join the company’s welcoming and friendly workforce, reporting to the Senior Development Manager. As a  Data Analyst your main responsibilities will include but are not limited to: - Conducting full lifecycle analysis to include data requirements generation, activities of complex baggage data and associated design- Developing analysis and reporting capabilities, monitoring performance to identify improvements- Interpreting data, analysing your results using statistical techniques and providing ongoing reports- Developing, implementing and maintaining databases, data collection systems and other strategies that optimise statistical efficiency and quality- Acquiring data from primary or secondary data sources- Identifying, analysing and interpreting trends or patterns in complex data sets- Working with stakeholders to prioritise business and information needsTo be considered for the Data Analyst role you must have proven and demonstrable working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst. In addition the following key skills and experience are essential: - BSc in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics- Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques- Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Power BI etc), databases (SQL etc), programming (XML and ETL frameworks)- Experience using statistical packages for analysing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc)- Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organise, analyse and disseminate significant amounts of information- Adapt at queries and presenting findings with the ability to generate professional looking reportsThe company will agree a training and development plan with the successful candidate.If you are interested in the Data Analyst role please apply by submitting a copy of your CV below.

 Are you a proactive data analyst with great attention to detail and ability to work with a number of different stakeholders, confident in delivering and maintaining dashboards to accommodate multiple levels of detail for various audiences? They are now looking to recruit a Data Analyst to join their Team in Warwick What will I be responsible for? As an analyst within our client, you will be delivering high profile projects whilst supporting continual evolution of dashboards and data insights for a premium vehicle manufacturer. Initially, the role will be essential in data cleansing, data collection and data verification from our client and establishing with the manager the various levels of detail required for each audience level. Demonstration of understanding stakeholder requirements yet delivering simple and effective levels of insight will be essential. Maintaining, developing and improving these dashboards will absorb the majority of the role past deployment of the initial dashboards. Could this be the ideal for me? As this role is split 50/50 over two major projects, stakeholder management, time management and ability to keep to tight deadlines will be critical. Our client's Data Analyst will also have the following skills and experience:  Proven experience in stakeholder managementAbility to multitask with flexible attitudeAftersales experience an advantageProven experience in driving productivity and keeping to deadlinesAbility to interpret, analyse and make recommendations from variable data sourcesStrong MS Office experience – Advanced Excel skills a must What can they offer you? Joining their team as a Data Analyst, you will be offered a salary up to £30,000 and a great range of company benefits including 25 days annual leave, company contributory pension plan, cash back health care scheme, life assurance, car salary exchange scheme,  exclusive discounts on everyday purchases as well as exclusive discounts on car purchases. You will also have the potential to progress within the company, with global opportunities updated regularly. About Our client With over 5,000 employees based in more than 80 countries across the globe, their teams provide industry leading expertise that spans:  Warranty & TechnicalParts & ServiceRetail Performance ManagementCustomer EngagementFleet & Mobility Building trust since 1931, their proven track record means that they now partner with almost every car manufacturer on the market.  Are you a proactive data analyst with great attention to detail and ability to work with a number of different stakeholders, confident in delivering and maintaining dashboards to accommodate multiple levels of detail for various audiences? They are now looking to recruit a Data Analyst to join their Team in Warwick What will I be responsible for? As an analyst within our client, you will be delivering high profile projects whilst supporting continual evolution of dashboards and data insights for a premium vehicle manufacturer. Initially, the role will be essential in data cleansing, data collection and data verification from our client and establishing with the manager the various levels of detail required for each audience level. Maintaining, developing and improving these dashboards will absorb the majority of the role past deployment of the initial dashboards. Could this be the ideal for me? Our client's Data Analyst will also have the following skills and experience:  Proven experience in stakeholder managementAbility to multitask with flexible attitudeAftersales experience an advantageProven experience in driving productivity and keeping to deadlinesAbility to interpret, analyse and make recommendations from variable data sourcesStrong MS Office experience – Advanced Excel skills a must What can they offer you? Joining their team as a Data Analyst, you will be offered a salary up to £30,000 and a great range of company benefits including 25 days annual leave, company contributory pension plan, cash back health care scheme, life assurance, car salary exchange scheme,  exclusive discounts on everyday purchases as well as exclusive discounts on car purchases.  Company Description The Rank Group is growing rapidly within both our Venues and Digital businesses. If you’re not sure who we are, you may be more familiar with us through our iconic brands; Mecca Bingo and Grosvenor Casino. We have most recently acquired Stride Gaming, which,  together with our existing Digital business, forms Rank Interactive. We employ circa 8,000 people globally, with our UK office functions being located in Maidenhead (Head Office), Sheffield (Customer Solutions Hub), London (Digital) and a further office in  Gibraltar, which is home to our existing Rank Digital function. We are evolving as a business and are adding some exciting new brands and concepts to our venues and digital offering. By joining an office-based or operational function with us, you’ll instantly  be part of a high-performing and inclusive culture, which works closely to support our Customer-facing teams. Job Description The Promotions Data Analyst will work in a high performing team to deliver the analysis of promotional activity, providing actionable insights, and proactively making recommendations on marketing and promotions decisions. Duties & Responsibilities:  Delivering strategic insight on marketing and promotion effectiveness to inform decisionsApply digital statistical techniques on large behavioural datasets to: - measure results and show key trends, - identify causal impact and attribution, - analyse experiments,  Measuring marketing efficiencies and supporting the bonus management process.Providing the marketing teams with promotional analysis support, tracking and reporting.Being aware of current promotional activities and behavioural trends, carrying out analysis to explain movements and summarising results of tests.Presenting findings to stakeholders and discuss strategies to drive performance across the business.Forming close working relationships with relevant stakeholders (Marketing, CRM and commercial teams) to influence the development of a strategic approach to promotions in order to identify opportunities which improve our value position.Providing input and analysis to aid trading meetings to make the most effective promotions decisions.Successfully carrying out weekly data and reporting requirements whilst ensuring these are robust and built as efficiently as possible.Providing ad hoc analysis for commercial departments and other areas of the business. Qualifications  Experience working in an analytical role, with knowledge of gambling and gaming preferableThe ability to distill complex analysis into clear findings and recommendations that can be easily understood and acted upon by the businessExperience of working closely with variety of stakeholders, and ability to communicate information clearly and conciselyBS/BA in quantitative field (Statistics, Digital Marketing, Economics, Mathematics, Operations Science)Knowledge of SQL and/or one of the following; Python, R, SAS, Data visualisation software

 Hastings Direct, Data AnalystAre you commercially and analytically minded and looking to play a fundamental role in an exciting and evolving product?The Telematics team (based in our Bexhill HQ) is a forward-thinking team looking to revolutionize and shape the way we look at insurance in the future. This exciting new role would place you in the heart of the analytical & pricing team where you can influence  and drive strategic initiatives central to achieving our group objectives.A STEM degree and experience is advantageous but, if you have strong baseline skills in software such as Excel and a keen desire to learn, the supportive Telematics team will invest in your development. You will learn from the experts and be able to carve out  your career in a role that will give you exposure to some key senior partners and departments crucial to the success of our business.The RoleThe purpose of this role is to act as the key point of contact for the Telematics team to complete analysis in a variety of areas to inform both commercial and customer outcomes using key analysis.Your remit will include the following;  Building and delivering robust MI and BI reporting to provide oversight to key stakeholders to support trading and business decisions, with a view of identifying key trends, spotting trading anomalies and working with the data analytics & pricing manager  to take action to support performanceKey point of contact for technical, data and analytical requests to support wider business functions in achieving the wider group's objectivesEnd-to-end responsibility for the implementation and testing of retail pricing changes and practices, providing detailed impact analysis for company and customerConduct ad hoc analysis, creating & testing various hypotheses raised by the teamOwnership of key business processes ensuring delivery within agreed timeframes, with an eye to improve the team's productivity via automated solutions Required experience  Highly analytical; able to clean, scrutinize and interrogate high volumes of complex data and translate into meaningful reports, insights and high level management informationHave a passion for data quality and integrity, cleansing and querying data from structured databasesAdvanced skills in the use of MS office applicationsGood communication and presentation skills (both verbal and written)Keen eye for detailPro-active approach to driving changeConfidence to express opinions and challenge othersEducated to A level in a numerical field (minimum) Desirable  Advantageous to have a BSc/MSc in Statistics / Computer Science / Physics / Operational Research / Engineering / Maths or other quantitative fieldExperience working with analytical, statistical & data manipulation packages (e.g. SQL, R, Python etc.)Strong knowledge of Insurance market & competitorsProven research skills, including ability to formulate hypotheses and identify ways to prove or disprove these with targeted testsExperience delivering commercial targets Personal attributes  As a growing business, your role can really help make an impact on both the development and delivery of this function - it will be exciting, busy, varied and challenging so a roll sleeves up, hands-on approach is an absolute must.Natural problem solver who communicates effectively to all stakeholders.This is a dynamic, fast paced working environment - candidates should be comfortable working within that setting and demonstrate a proactive working style.Great attention to detail - systematic approach to managing your workload.Embraces opportunities to develop and learn - shows a great level of self-awareness and drive. Benefits for youPlease find some of the great benefits we offer here at Hastings Direct;  Competitive basic salary which we will share with you upon shortlisting, but do feel free to email the Recruitment team for more details in advance of your application - Flexible working opportunities working 1-2 days a week from homeUp to 5% bonus earning potential25 days holidayCompetitive pensionFlexible benefits - buy or sell holidays, opt in dental and healthcare cash plansDiscounted Hastings Direct productsA test and learn culture Hastings Group is an equal opportunities employer which means we treat people fairly. We welcome applications from all suitably skilled persons regardless of their gender, age, race, disability, ethnic background, religion/belief, sexual orientation, gender  reassignment or marital/family status. title: Data Analyst
body:
Competitive salary









Glastonbury



, Somerset




Permanent, full-time



                Be one of the first ten applicants
            






                        Apply now
                    


 About us Cars and pollution are dominating our city environments in a way that is not sustainable; both for the planet and our health. Pure was born from a desire to build a business that is not just about selling products, but to create a platform that could help  solve some of the biggest environmental issues we face today. It has become our passion and mission to change the way the world thinks about transport and inspire an electric micro revolution. By offering the best and most advanced electric transport solutions,  we will help shape the way we move around our urban environments and at the same time help reduce the environmental impact on us as individuals, communities and the world we live in We don’t believe we are here to just sell scooters. We are here to change  the future. Are you in? About the Role Currently our data is fragmented and its complexity means we are not mining the data for insights effectively enough. We have an opportunity to enable better decision making through dramatically improved insight access. We need an analyst that has a strategic  focus who can design a data strategy that encompasses all areas of data and insight that will lay the foundation for success; processes, data reporting and strategy development going forward. You will be responsible for ensuring insights are more visible and  delivered in a timely way to key stakeholders at the to drive informed decision making This full-time role, based in the South West of England, is an exciting opportunity to develop your skill set and work alongside an ambitious, passionate team focused on  pushing boundaries, being disruptive and growing fast. What you’ll be doing  Consulting with stakeholders to determine data requirements  Conducting a full review of available data sources including:  Existing data sources  Storage locations and format  Data quality and alignment to KPIs  Data and reporting processes  Understanding data and providing ad hoc analysis from our primary web analytics tool, Google Analytics  Reporting on and offering insight into business split (A/B) testing, enhancements to sales funnel and other site changes, taking ownership of tracking quality across website(s), ensuring consistent tracking, analysis and reporting of core website KPI’s  Taking responsibility for BAU tagging through Google Tag Manager and supporting with the user testing process, primarily run by the Product and UX teams  Confirming KPIs and metrics that report strategy performance and support business objectives  Building short-term and long-term reporting for key areas and requirements  Reviewing gaps and develop plan to remedy or escalate detections which give cause for concern  Conducting analysis to detect trends and anomalies, deliver competitive insights into marketing and business strategy  Managing, segmenting and mining data to support CRM and email campaigns based on behavior and customer trends  Mining customer journey data to help us better understand where and how we can better target and market to the customer in their journey  Participating in forums, meetings or events to interpret data and support decision making Ideally, this person would have experience in specialist Ecommerce reporting tools, such as Google Analytics. In these roles typically the data integrity from a website perspective is around ensuring all the tracking of digital marketing is working. I have  summarised it in these bullets below, it maybe too detailed/need the tone amending. What you will bring to the role;  Experience in and be able to develop an initial data strategy  Experience in working across multiple and varied sources of data  Demonstrated knowledge of data structure, data systems/tools and related software and data management policies and practices (Google Analytics, AB testing, user testing etc)  Creative in their approach to data presentation so people engage, easily understand and are inspired by data  Strategic in their thinking - proactive in mining the data for new and interesting insights that allow the business to be competitive  Experience of running segmentation analysis on exiting data to better understand our customers to create matched samples to be more targeted in paid  The ability to work at speed in a fast turnaround environment, without sacrificing quality of content  Be comfortable juggling multiple projects simultaneously  You need to be an enthusiastic and dynamic yet collaborative team player with a high degree of integrity and personal responsibility  Proactive, self-starting attitude What we offer  Competitive salary, pension contribution and 23 days’ holiday  An awesome countryside location in the South West of England  Free use of on-site gym, free lunch, refreshments and fresh fruit every day!  Real career progression opportunities, with the chance to grow as we do Pure is committed to equality of opportunity for all staff, and applications from all suitably qualified individuals are encouraged, regardless of age, disability, sex, gender reassignment, sexual orientation, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief  and marriage and civil partnerships At Pure we like to find our own tribe so please no agencies. Benefits:  Discounted/free foodOn-site parkingSubsidised gym membershipCasual dress

 Job Title: Data AnalystReporting To: Data & Insight ManagerLocation: Wilmslow Hours of Work: 09:00 - 17:30 or in line with business needsSalary: £28-30kThe RoleA Citation Data Analyst will be able to adapt to a fast paced and evolving architectural landscape. It's a great place to work because of the people we employ. Fun and professional, we want likeminded individuals who love to love their job (no 'mood hoovers' here thanks!) and want the Company to succeed. So if our culture sounds like a good fit for you and you want to be part of our success story, then send us your details.

 My client a niche Investment Company is now looking for a Data Analyst to join the ever-growing friendly team. Working very closely with the Group Information Manager, you will help to maintain and optimise the reporting suite and make information easily available to key stakeholders. At the same time, as all areas of the business are growing in multiple directions, new products, reports and tools are needed. You will become a key player in analysing and developing the best solution available with other members of staff. This role will include developing an expert understanding of how their data is structured, how it is captured and presented and what insights can be derived from it. You will be learning about the businesses and improve upon the reporting and data collection tools already in place and build out the tools and dashboards to deliver data for all teams across the company. You should be highly numerate with excellent problem-solving skills and have an understanding and experience of working with complex relational databases. Experience of using SQL to extract the insight from the database through writing complex queries using a wide variety of data as well as preparing, consolidating and normalising data: ETL processes. Previous knowledge of data visualisation and dashboard tools e.g. Qlikview, Tableau or Microsoft Power BI would be beneficial. You should be an excellent communicator comfortable dealing with all levels and types of user and in return, my client can offer significant room to grow and expand your experience.  Your new role At Patient our mission is simple: to create scalable, modern and user-friendly products that will help people feel better and live longer. With Patient Access, we’ve built the UK’s largest online GP services platform with over 7 million users and counting, which gives people better control over their health. With Patient.info, we’ve developed one of the world’s leading independent health websites, providing trusted clinical information and healthy living advice to a million global visitors every day. This is just the beginning, the next few years promise to be exciting, fast-paced and incredibly rewarding as we continue to fulfil our mission and reshape the way people manage their health. In this role you’ll really make a tangible difference to millions of peoples’ lives, utilising highly technical data analysis techniques (with R, Python, SQL and cloud computing) on huge datasets to generate and present actionable insights to key business  areas. The team you’ll join You’ll join our Data Analytics team of four, managed by Kuldeep, which works alongside all parts of the company, helping us turn customer behaviour data into meaningful commercial insights. What you’ll bring These are the skills and experience you’ll need to set yourself up for success in this role, however we’d still love to talk to you even if you don’t tick all of them:  A passion for data! You will love turning data into meaningful patternsSolid experience with one or more of: R, SQL or PythonA track record in a commercial environment utilising multiple data modelling techniques e.g. cluster analysis, decision trees, regression and other machine learning techniquesGreat communication skills, with ability to present results and insights to colleagues including Jason, our chief exec in a clear, concise and unambiguous way. What we’ll give you As well as a competitive salary, you’ll get a benefits package which includes things like a pension, life assurance, gym discounts, summer BBQs on our roof terrace, regular office food and drinks, and free fruit all week! We also take our corporate social responsibility pretty seriously and we believe in giving back to our community, so you’ll get the chance to be involved in lots of fundraising events throughout the year. Our latest one was a challenge to complete up to  a 100km walk over 24hrs across the Peak District! So if this snapshot of the role looks interesting, click apply. Marketing Data Analyst - salary up to £40,000 pa (dependent on experience), Permanent, City LondonWho will you be working for?Our Client is an innovative leader in financial education and examinations with over 2 decades of unrivalled experience in delivering these specialist services to the finance sector. This position reports directly into the Global Head.What will you be doing?As Marketing Data Analyst, you will take the lead in optimising customer journey outcome and support the business development using data analysis.Your day-to-day is likely to also include:* Researching and reporting on lead performance, product portfolio and customer value.* Build strong working relationships across departments including marketing and sales to ensure data governance and compliance.* Act up as first point of contact for all enquiries relating to data, salesforce and CRM queries.* Monitoring of leads generated with the objective of increasing productivity.* Implementation of targeting and testing processes/models.* Advising internal teams; marketing for example on email automation strategy.* Generally, data analyses where required.What do you need?As Marketing Data Analyst,you will have the following:* Exceptional practical knowledge of CRM, Salesforce and email automations.* You will have a minimum of 2 years' experience within a similar role.* Previous experience with one of the following Marketo, Silverpop, Eloqua or Hubspot.* Highly capable and confident user of Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint and Word.* Ability to work well under pressure and within a fast-paced environment.* Commercial, positive and flexible approach to working independently and as part of a team.* Good attention to detail.What's in it for you?This is an exciting permanent opportunity to work for a professional and reputable company.You can expect to receive a competitive basic salary of 40,000-£45,000 pa (dependent on experience). This package will also include private medical insurance (post 1 month service), generous holiday entitlement, employee pension contribution and death in service.How to applyPlease select the 'apply' button and upload your cv in the pop-out window to be considered for this roleYOU MUST UPLOAD YOUR CV IN THE POP-OUT WINDOW TO BE CONSIDERED FOR THIS ROLE

title: Promotions Data Analyst
body:
Competitive salary









Kentish Town



, London




Permanent, full-time







                        Apply on employer's website
                    


 Company Description The Rank Group is growing rapidly within both our Venues and Digital businesses. If you’re not sure who we are, you may be more familiar with us through our iconic brands; Mecca Bingo and Grosvenor Casino. We have most recently acquired Stride Gaming, which,  together with our existing Digital business, forms Rank Interactive. We employ circa 8,000 people globally, with our UK office functions being located in Maidenhead (Head Office), Sheffield (Customer Solutions Hub), London (Digital) and a further office in  Gibraltar, which is home to our existing Rank Digital function. We are evolving as a business and are adding some exciting new brands and concepts to our venues and digital offering. By joining an office-based or operational function with us, you’ll instantly  be part of a high-performing and inclusive culture, which works closely to support our Customer-facing teams. Job Description The Promotions Data Analyst will work in a high performing team to deliver the analysis of promotional activity, providing actionable insights, and proactively making recommendations on marketing and promotions decisions. Duties & Responsibilities:  Delivering strategic insight on marketing and promotion effectiveness to inform decisionsApply digital statistical techniques on large behavioural datasets to: - measure results and show key trends, - identify causal impact and attribution, - analyse experiments,  Measuring marketing efficiencies and supporting the bonus management process.Providing the marketing teams with promotional analysis support, tracking and reporting.Being aware of current promotional activities and behavioural trends, carrying out analysis to explain movements and summarising results of tests.Presenting findings to stakeholders and discuss strategies to drive performance across the business.Forming close working relationships with relevant stakeholders (Marketing, CRM and commercial teams) to influence the development of a strategic approach to promotions in order to identify opportunities which improve our value position.Providing input and analysis to aid trading meetings to make the most effective promotions decisions.Successfully carrying out weekly data and reporting requirements whilst ensuring these are robust and built as efficiently as possible.Providing ad hoc analysis for commercial departments and other areas of the business. Qualifications  Experience working in an analytical role, with knowledge of gambling and gaming preferableThe ability to distill complex analysis into clear findings and recommendations that can be easily understood and acted upon by the businessExperience of working closely with variety of stakeholders, and ability to communicate information clearly and conciselyBS/BA in quantitative field (Statistics, Digital Marketing, Economics, Mathematics, Operations Science)Knowledge of SQL and/or one of the following; Python, R, SAS, Data visualisation software

 Data Analyst, Erith, Kent.  £25,000 basic salary with OTE of £28,000  The Würth Group is a leading industrial consumable products provider with over 400 companies and a global workforce of 75,000. Our dedication to quality products and excellent customer service has earned us an enviable reputation and on-going growth. Our  divisional Field Sales Consultants sell across four main industries; Automotive, Wood, Metal & Construction. Our aim is to drive sales and grow our business with existing customers and seek out opportunities through new customers. Position Summary The successful candidate will analyse all e-Business related data that comes from our customer's interactions with the brand online for both Würth UK and Würth Ire. As part of the role you will have a direct input into the strategy of the e-Business department  communicating insights and providing solutions that have demonstrable results. Essential duties and responsibilities  Define key performance indicators and identify the most relevant data to improve existing reporting.Interpretation of data and analysis of customer online behaviour so as to make recommendations to influence strategic decision making in the department.Work with the colleagues responsible for inbound marketing to provide strategic insight backed up by data of current customer behaviour to improve conversion rates and focus budget.Work with IT colleagues and tracking software platforms to get in place, configure and test different tracking snippets.Other duties as assigned by your line manager. Requirements  Strong quantitative analytical skills.Strong attention to detail and accuracy.2 years' experience in web analysis, online commerce or related fields.Advanced knowledge of web analytics platforms such as (GA & PIWIK) and Excel is required.Knowledge of and experience in GTM is essential with knowledge of Hotjar software advantageous.The successful candidate will be proactive and must have great communication skills and a can do attitude.Degree in Business Administration or equivalent advantageous but not essential. If this sounds like you and you would like to build a career with a modern, progressive company with an eye on the future, apply for this position by clicking the button below. Be a part of the Würth success story; work in a positive environment alongside  a multi-national team.

Marketing Data AnalystAre you a Marketing Data Analyst who has strong knowledge and experiences with Salesforce and CRM? In addition, if you are seeking a fast-paced position with a commercial focus I would encourage you to read on. Marketing Data Analyst - salary up to £40,000 pa (dependent on experience), Permanent, City LondonWho will you be working for?Our Client is an innovative leader in financial education and examinations with over 2 decades of unrivalled experience in delivering these specialist services to the finance sector. This position reports directly into the Global Head.What will you be doing?As Marketing Data Analyst, you will take the lead in optimising customer journey outcome and support the business development using data analysis.Your day-to-day is likely to also include:* Researching and reporting on lead performance, product portfolio and customer value.* Build strong working relationships across departments including marketing and sales to ensure data governance and compliance.* Act up as first point of contact for all enquiries relating to data, salesforce and CRM queries.* Monitoring of leads generated with the objective of increasing productivity.* Implementation of targeting and testing processes/models.* Advising internal teams; marketing for example on email automation strategy.* Generally, data analyses where required.What do you need?As Marketing Data Analyst,you will have the following:* Exceptional practical knowledge of CRM, Salesforce and email automations.* You will have a minimum of 2 years' experience within a similar role.* Previous experience with one of the following Marketo, Silverpop, Eloqua or Hubspot.* Highly capable and confident user of Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint and Word.* Ability to work well under pressure and within a fast-paced environment.* Commercial, positive and flexible approach to working independently and as part of a team.* Good attention to detail.What's in it for you?This is an exciting permanent opportunity to work for a professional and reputable company.You can expect to receive a competitive basic salary of 40,000-£45,000 pa (dependent on experience). This package will also include private medical insurance (post 1 month service), generous holiday entitlement, employee pension contribution and death in service.How to applyPlease select the 'apply' button and upload your cv in the pop-out window to be considered for this roleYOU MUST UPLOAD YOUR CV IN THE POP-OUT WINDOW TO BE CONSIDERED FOR THIS ROLE

body:
Salary negotiable









City of London



, London

                        Apply on employer's website
                    


 Your new role At Patient our mission is simple: to create scalable, modern and user-friendly products that will help people feel better and live longer. With Patient Access, we’ve built the UK’s largest online GP services platform with over 7 million users and counting, which gives people better control over their health. With Patient.info, we’ve developed one of the world’s leading independent health websites, providing trusted clinical information and healthy living advice to a million global visitors every day. This is just the beginning, the next few years promise to be exciting, fast-paced and incredibly rewarding as we continue to fulfil our mission and reshape the way people manage their health. In this role you’ll really make a tangible difference to millions of peoples’ lives, utilising highly technical data analysis techniques (with R, Python, SQL and cloud computing) on huge datasets to generate and present actionable insights to key business  areas. The team you’ll join You’ll join our Data Analytics team of four, managed by Kuldeep, which works alongside all parts of the company, helping us turn customer behaviour data into meaningful commercial insights. What you’ll bring These are the skills and experience you’ll need to set yourself up for success in this role, however we’d still love to talk to you even if you don’t tick all of them:  A passion for data! You will love turning data into meaningful patternsSolid experience with one or more of: R, SQL or PythonA track record in a commercial environment utilising multiple data modelling techniques e.g. cluster analysis, decision trees, regression and other machine learning techniquesGreat communication skills, with ability to present results and insights to colleagues including Jason, our chief exec in a clear, concise and unambiguous way. What we’ll give you As well as a competitive salary, you’ll get a benefits package which includes things like a pension, life assurance, gym discounts, summer BBQs on our roof terrace, regular office food and drinks, and free fruit all week! We also take our corporate social responsibility pretty seriously and we believe in giving back to our community, so you’ll get the chance to be involved in lots of fundraising events throughout the year. Our latest one was a challenge to complete up to  a 100km walk over 24hrs across the Peak District! So if this snapshot of the role looks interesting, click apply.  Role Reporting and Data Analyst Reporting Lines The Reporting and Data Analyst will report to the Head of Information Services and Development. Overview The Reporting and Data Analyst will support data driven decisions making by utilising a range of data sources and tools to produce timely, focused and accurate information. Duties and Responsibilities  Working with the Head of Information Services and Development to engage with stakeholders to ascertain information requirements.To support the report cycles and ad-hoc reporting needs by sourcing data from multiple sources, collating analysing and producing reports.Manipulation of data in spreadsheets to produce meaningful information to stakeholdersMaintenance and modification of existing reportsMigration of existing data sourcing and reporting solutions to SSRS reportsCreating, using and managing stored procedures and functionsAny other duties as reasonably requested by your line manager. Person Specification Experience:  Strong knowledge of SSRS reportingKnowledge of SQL and ability to write complex queriesKnowledge and experience of T-SQLKnowledge of Database and Management Information SystemsExperience of working with multiple stakeholders with conflicting demandsExperience of using advanced features of Microsoft Office suite including MS ExcelExperience of Power BIFamiliarity with C#Experience of MS Microsoft SharePoint Qualifications:  Strong A Levels or equivalent.A university degree to at least undergraduate level Skills & Abilities:  Excellent verbal, written and listening skills to communicate with users at all levels and of varying technical abilityStrong interpersonal skills.Excellent numeracy skills to deal with statistical data.A structured, and organised approach to work, with the ability to manage own workload and meet deadlinesAwareness of current data protection legislation.Able to work independently and as part of a team and be flexible.An ability to take instruction and direction and to be held accountableExcellent time-management and an ability to prioritise effectively.Ability to work calmly under pressure. title: Promotions Data Analyst
body:
Competitive salary









Kentish Town



, London




Permanent, full-time







                        Apply on employer's website
                    


 Company Description The Rank Group is growing rapidly within both our Venues and Digital businesses. If you’re not sure who we are, you may be more familiar with us through our iconic brands; Mecca Bingo and Grosvenor Casino. We have most recently acquired Stride Gaming, which,  together with our existing Digital business, forms Rank Interactive. We employ circa 8,000 people globally, with our UK office functions being located in Maidenhead (Head Office), Sheffield (Customer Solutions Hub), London (Digital) and a further office in  Gibraltar, which is home to our existing Rank Digital function. We are evolving as a business and are adding some exciting new brands and concepts to our venues and digital offering. By joining an office-based or operational function with us, you’ll instantly  be part of a high-performing and inclusive culture, which works closely to support our Customer-facing teams. Job Description The Promotions Data Analyst will work in a high performing team to deliver the analysis of promotional activity, providing actionable insights, and proactively making recommendations on marketing and promotions decisions. Duties & Responsibilities:  Delivering strategic insight on marketing and promotion effectiveness to inform decisionsApply digital statistical techniques on large behavioural datasets to: - measure results and show key trends, - identify causal impact and attribution, - analyse experiments,  Measuring marketing efficiencies and supporting the bonus management process.Providing the marketing teams with promotional analysis support, tracking and reporting.Being aware of current promotional activities and behavioural trends, carrying out analysis to explain movements and summarising results of tests.Presenting findings to stakeholders and discuss strategies to drive performance across the business.Forming close working relationships with relevant stakeholders (Marketing, CRM and commercial teams) to influence the development of a strategic approach to promotions in order to identify opportunities which improve our value position.Providing input and analysis to aid trading meetings to make the most effective promotions decisions.Successfully carrying out weekly data and reporting requirements whilst ensuring these are robust and built as efficiently as possible.Providing ad hoc analysis for commercial departments and other areas of the business. Qualifications  Experience working in an analytical role, with knowledge of gambling and gaming preferableThe ability to distill complex analysis into clear findings and recommendations that can be easily understood and acted upon by the businessExperience of working closely with variety of stakeholders, and ability to communicate information clearly and conciselyBS/BA in quantitative field (Statistics, Digital Marketing, Economics, Mathematics, Operations Science)Knowledge of SQL and/or one of the following; Python, R, SAS, Data visualisation software

We are currently looking for an Interim Data Analyst to assist with data collation for our Goods not for Resale project, as part of the Category Management team at SIG Distribution based from Head Office in Sheffield. If you have a background in analysing  large datasets and cleansing large amounts of data with a high attention to detail and love ensuring a job is done well, this could be the role for you!What does the role involve? This role is a 3 month fixed term vacancy for a Data Analyst to proactively collate data for our GNFR project. As an Analyst, you will work to identify information, produce reports and improve data quality. You will work alongside the Data Collection Administrator  to produce the information required to enable the interim Category Manager to negotiate with and consolidate suppliers in the Goods not for Resale sector. You will need great communication skills and the ability to work on your own initiative, but also as part of a team. You’ll need great  Microsoft Excel skills with the ability to produce pivot tables and have a passion for detail and research as you will be consistently compiling information into reports. You’ll need great stakeholder management skills which will enable you to work closely  with all levels of the business.We need an extremely positive individual for this roles, with a high attention to detail and the ability to work to very tight timescales. If you’re from a Manufacturing, Operations or FMCG background, then this may be the role for you.About usSIG is a leading supplier of specialist construction materials, distributing throughout the UK, Europe and the Middle East. From groundworks to the roof and everything in between, we deliver the full range of specialist materials to the construction industry.A group turnover of circa £2.7 billon and with numerous branches here in the UK alone, we’re also a fantastic place to build your career.Our customers are at the very heart of what we do and how we do things. We also like  to have fun!

body:

 Hastings Direct, Data AnalystAre you commercially and analytically minded and looking to play a fundamental role in an exciting and evolving product?The Telematics team (based in our Bexhill HQ) is a forward-thinking team looking to revolutionize and shape the way we look at insurance in the future. This exciting new role would place you in the heart of the analytical & pricing team where you can influence  and drive strategic initiatives central to achieving our group objectives.A STEM degree and experience is advantageous but, if you have strong baseline skills in software such as Excel and a keen desire to learn, the supportive Telematics team will invest in your development. You will learn from the experts and be able to carve out  your career in a role that will give you exposure to some key senior partners and departments crucial to the success of our business.The RoleThe purpose of this role is to act as the key point of contact for the Telematics team to complete analysis in a variety of areas to inform both commercial and customer outcomes using key analysis.Your remit will include the following;  Building and delivering robust MI and BI reporting to provide oversight to key stakeholders to support trading and business decisions, with a view of identifying key trends, spotting trading anomalies and working with the data analytics & pricing manager  to take action to support performanceKey point of contact for technical, data and analytical requests to support wider business functions in achieving the wider group's objectivesEnd-to-end responsibility for the implementation and testing of retail pricing changes and practices, providing detailed impact analysis for company and customerConduct ad hoc analysis, creating & testing various hypotheses raised by the teamOwnership of key business processes ensuring delivery within agreed timeframes, with an eye to improve the team's productivity via automated solutions Required experience  Highly analytical; able to clean, scrutinize and interrogate high volumes of complex data and translate into meaningful reports, insights and high level management informationHave a passion for data quality and integrity, cleansing and querying data from structured databasesAdvanced skills in the use of MS office applicationsGood communication and presentation skills (both verbal and written)Keen eye for detailPro-active approach to driving changeConfidence to express opinions and challenge othersEducated to A level in a numerical field (minimum) Desirable  Advantageous to have a BSc/MSc in Statistics / Computer Science / Physics / Operational Research / Engineering / Maths or other quantitative fieldExperience working with analytical, statistical & data manipulation packages (e.g. SQL, R, Python etc.)Strong knowledge of Insurance market & competitorsProven research skills, including ability to formulate hypotheses and identify ways to prove or disprove these with targeted testsExperience delivering commercial targets Personal attributes  As a growing business, your role can really help make an impact on both the development and delivery of this function - it will be exciting, busy, varied and challenging so a roll sleeves up, hands-on approach is an absolute must.Natural problem solver who communicates effectively to all stakeholders.This is a dynamic, fast paced working environment - candidates should be comfortable working within that setting and demonstrate a proactive working style.Great attention to detail - systematic approach to managing your workload.Embraces opportunities to develop and learn - shows a great level of self-awareness and drive. Benefits for youPlease find some of the great benefits we offer here at Hastings Direct;  Competitive basic salary which we will share with you upon shortlisting, but do feel free to email the Recruitment team for more details in advance of your application - Flexible working opportunities working 1-2 days a week from homeUp to 5% bonus earning potential25 days holidayCompetitive pensionFlexible benefits - buy or sell holidays, opt in dental and healthcare cash plansDiscounted Hastings Direct productsA test and learn culture Hastings Group is an equal opportunities employer which means we treat people fairly. We welcome applications from all suitably skilled persons regardless of their gender, age, race, disability, ethnic background, religion/belief, sexual orientation, gender  reassignment or marital/family status. Please also note that we have a thorough referencing process, which includes credit and criminal record checks.

body:
Salary negotiable









Kingston Upon Thames



, Surrey




Permanent, full-time







                        Apply now
                    


 Our client, a leading Financial Software organisation based in Kingston are looking for a Data Migration Analyst to project manage the onboarding of new clients and migrate their data from their current CRM onto the new software. The role of the Data Migration Analyst is to liaise with clients, project manage and undertake the implementation and configuration of the organisations move to the new software. Extract data from various 3rd party solutions from formats such as Access,  Excel, Filemaker and SQL (to name but four) . Support in cleansing extracted data with the intention of importing into the new software. Help with documenting processes to support the Data Migration department and its functions. Implementation Specific: * Work with the Onboarding Team throughout the implementation process ensuring configuration requirements are fully captured and configured in preparation for the client's Go-Live date  Work with new customers to ensure:- * Update implementation projects as necessary * Keep in contact or on occasion meet with the Client to discuss data migration requirements * Ensure the project has completed all outstanding deliverables assigned Data Migration Specific: * Work with Sales Team and assist with the acquisition of new accounts * Work with the Onboarding Team to ensure data migration requirements are fully captured and understood, helping with the cleansing of client data when required * Work with Customer Relationship Managers keeping them abreast of new acquisition projects * Liaise with Service Delivery to ensure all scripts used are current and fulfil requirements for Data Migrations and Implementations * Research and undertake necessary business analysis to help with the design and creation of new data extract and data import services * Creation of SQL scripts to assist with further data extracts, cleansing and / or imports Project Management Specific: * Work alongside the Onboarding Team throughout the entire project life cycle to ensure their go-live date and milestones are met along the way * Ensure the customer has a point of contact throughout their project life cycle Knowledge required:* Highly proficiency in Excel * Microsoft Office/PC skills, including Access and Word * Knowledge and use of SQL Querying * Powershell scripting advantageous * Experience in a Data Analyst or Business Analyst role preferable * Experience within a financial services institution with specific experience in project management and data migration * VBA Skills and Experience:* Impeccable attention to detail, with passion for processes and systems * Ability to thrive both in an independent and team environment * Ability to prioritise effectively and handle shifting priorities professionally * Excellent written and oral communication skills*Some experience of client facing exposure or project management of implementing web-based systems Qualifications: * Graduate * Experience managing client expectations * Some experience of client facing exposure or project management of implementing web-based systems Parkside Recruitment Ltd is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy. Parkside Recruitment is an Equal Opportunities Employer.

title: Marketing Data Analyst
body:
£35,000 - £40,000 per annum, negotiable















Bolton



, Lancashire




Permanent, full-time







                        Apply now
                    


 35-40k per annum Bolton A flourishing Financial Services business based in Bolton is looking to recruit a Marketing Data Analyst to act as "Analytics Translator" within their growing Marketing function. The business has a real focus on making decisions based on data and keen to strengthen their focus on tracking campaigns, segmentation of the CRM database and identify market trends, response rates and return on investment. If you love data then this is certainly the role for you as there is a mix of analysis and insight involved in the role. The Marketing Data Analyst will gather customer information and examine trends to further support the business plan and marketing strategy. To be considered for the role of a Marketing Analyst, you should have demonstrable experience of:  Manipulating, analysing and reporting on data using varied systems including: CRM, Databases, MS Excel, SQL, Google Analytics or other market standard or online analysis packages  Producing reports based on insight analysis from social media sites and lead generation tools  Strong interpersonal skills to present your findings Key duties of a Marketing Data Analyst:  To develop a thorough understanding and insight into the company's consumer base and customer traffic  Deliver targeted data extracts for marketing campaigns and produce full evaluations of all campaigns, including recommendations on how to improve response and ROI from marketing and sales activities  To manage the operation of the customer satisfaction process, including data extraction, survey implementation, analysing the results and ensuring that the business reacts to comments  Be proactive in delivering regular management information to the Marketing Director and the Senior Management team  Present findings in a consistent, cohesive and comprehensible way, both in written reports and formal presentations.  Development of the customer database and data analysis tools. This will include highlighting data quality issues and cleansing of the database as and when required  To manage and report on key market intelligence and competitor activity, relevant to each business sector  To solve critical and complex data orientated business questions relating to customer, sector and prospect behaviour Experience required:  It is essential to have a minimum of 3 years experience of working within a similar role and have knowledge of:  Google Analytics, online analytics or another relevant web analytics solution  MS Dynamics & SQL experience preferably  Strong presentations and communications skills In return you will work within a commercially driven and fast paced business where you can make a real impact. The salary is negotiable circa: 35-40k plus exceptional company benefits package. Please apply to Suzanne at Square Peg Associates

Pearson VUE provides a full suite of services from test development to data management,  and delivers exams through the world’s most comprehensive and secure network of test centres in more than 180 countries, where we validate the skills and knowledge of millions of individuals every year. Fulfil specific requests for results related information from various departments, including Program Management, Testing Services, QA, and Development teams.  Ensure superior customer service and technical support for internal and external customers of Pearson VUE applications.  Proactively look for opportunity to avoid operational trouble areas and signal on any potential areas for improvement.  Report all network specific issues to the network team for resolution.  All employees have a responsibility to co-operate in promoting and maintaining a safe and healthy working environment, and to take reasonable care of their own health and safety at work and that of all other staff that may be affected by their acts or omissions.  Line managers have specific responsibility for the health and safety oftheir direct reports and other team members for which they have general management responsibility.  All employees are also responsible for supporting and implementing the company’s policies and procedures around the Health and Safety, Security, Quality and Business Continuity arrangements that apply in their role/work function. Full details of these policies  and procedures are available on SharePoint.  Key Activities   Day-to-day monitoring and management of exam results data.  Client related support activities.  Successfully complete any specific project work as directed by the team leader.  Prioritise workload based on urgency and impact to customers and the business.  Providing information on request to internal departments.  Research and investigation of software bugs / fixes and escalation to appropriate channels.  Reporting complete data flow and outlining flaws in transmission of results.  Assist all software release activity for all parties impacted.  Support KPI’s as discussed with manager.  Support evaluation and implementation of new technologies.  Produce regular management reports to keep management apprised of any significant changes in performance of applications.  Assist with other projects as they arise, and complete other ad hoc tasks as assigned by manager.  Pearson is an equal opportunities employer. We do not discriminate against employees or job applicants and select the best person for each job based on relevant skills and experience. We are also committed to building an accurate picture of the make-up of the workforce and encouraging equality and diversity. The information you provide will stay confidential, and be stored securely. It will not be seen by those involved in making decisions as part of the recruitment process. Experience in a similar role.  General knowledge of internet communication and networking configurations and troubleshooting.  Excellent written and verbal communication skills.  Must be able to actively demonstrate a logical and analytical approach to problem solving.  Effective time management.  Effective planning and prioritizing skills.  Excellent conflict management skills.  Excellent customer service skills.  Ability to work in a team environment.  Strong attention to detail.  Quick learner and ability to adapt to new systems and operating environments.  Experience with Microsoft Office, and associated packages, including Access, Excel and SQL Scripting.  Desirable Experience & Qualifications   Educated to A Level or equivalent – Degree in relevant subject preferred.  Qualification in ITIL or similar preferable.  Demonstrated documentation and training skills.  Ability to install/configure IT hardware/component would be advantageous.  Utilisation of helpdesk tools (e.g. Remedy).  SQL Skills  Previous experience of living and working in the location/regions  Working Arrangements   Must be able to work full time flexible hours to meet demands of the business  Occasional travel may be required to support client requirements. Who we are  At Iress, we believe technology should help people perform better every day. Since our beginning in 1993, people across financial services have trusted us to take their performance to the next level. From the world’s most established financial brands to  new and disruptive players, we help improve every aspect of our clients’ businesses so that they can work better, every day. Iress is one of Australia’s largest technology companies and employs more than 1,900 people across Australia, United Kingdom, South Africa, Canada, New Zealand and Asia. The role  As a Data Migration Analyst, you will be responsible for the end to end process for data migration from a client’s source system to Iress' systems. This is a diverse and versatile role where you will be covering client side consultancy to establish data  requirements, data mapping between source and target systems and guiding and supporting clients with their migrations into Xplan from various financial planning and CRM software systems. You will work closely with clients and other teams within the business  to understand and document their requirements and create specifications. Setting and managing client expectations in line with the project plan is key and you will be responsible for coordinating the process including managing data migration development and  testing and gaining customer sign off.  What you will be doing   Manage assigned transitions to Xplan from a variety of 3rd party systemsIdentify conversion requirements and manage client expectationsDocument the data requirements from clients and translate them into specifications & facilitate client sign offPro-actively identify and address issues that have the potential to impact a conversionImprove tools and processes as identified from feedback gatheredCommunicate regularly with to stakeholders with regards to progressAssist clients in reviewing converted data, resolving conversion feedback items and performing assigned data repairs (using existing tools) What you will need  A working knowledge of financial planning software or experience working within financial planning or wealth/trading industryExperience working with Microsoft SQL Server and Database Management toolsHands-on experience working with multiple forms of Databases.Knowledge of file management, data handling and securityExcellent problem solving skills and experience of data transformation and repairComfortable working in a fast paced, reactive, team environment and able to juggle changing priorities and workloadStrong communication skills - confident liaising with teams internally as well as with clients and external stakeholders Why work with us   Competitive remuneration  Global opportunities  Casual dress, flexible work policy  Access to learning and development programs  Health Benefits including Private Medical Insurance  Iress Community  3 days’ leave per year for charity initiatives  Global 36-hour hackathon  Cycle to Work scheme  25 days holiday plus Bank Holidays  Profit Share Plan  Up to 26 weeks’ paid parental leave for primary carers (up to 4 weeks for secondary carers), and the ability to work part-time when returning to work

 We are looking for a highly motivated versatile data analyst to join our Global Automotive Protection business unit. Having the ability to present findings to key stakeholders and clientsAbility to operate sensitively in multinational environment and build effective working relationships with clients and key stakeholders across the businessHighly organised and efficient. Able to manage own work load, and to deliver high quality outputs within tight deadlinesExperience in the insurance industry, particularly the automotive sector will be an advantageExperience with generalized linear modelling techniques and the Emblem software package will be an advantageExperience with other programming languages and tools such as R, Python, Tableau and Power BI will be an advantage At QBE, we view our people as our most precious asset.
