 Your new role At Patient our mission is simple: to create scalable, modern and user-friendly products that will help people feel better and live longer. With Patient Access, we’ve built the UK’s largest online GP services platform with over 7 million users and counting, which gives people better control over their health. With Patient.info, we’ve developed one of the world’s leading independent health websites, providing trusted clinical information and healthy living advice to a million global visitors every day. This is just the beginning, the next few years promise to be exciting, fast-paced and incredibly rewarding as we continue to fulfil our mission and reshape the way people manage their health. In this role you’ll really make a tangible difference to millions of peoples’ lives, utilising highly technical data analysis techniques (with R, Python, SQL and cloud computing) on huge datasets to generate and present actionable insights to key business  areas. The team you’ll join You’ll join our Data Analytics team of four, managed by Kuldeep, which works alongside all parts of the company, helping us turn customer behaviour data into meaningful commercial insights. What you’ll bring These are the skills and experience you’ll need to set yourself up for success in this role, however we’d still love to talk to you even if you don’t tick all of them:  A passion for data! You will love turning data into meaningful patternsSolid experience with one or more of: R, SQL or PythonA track record in a commercial environment utilising multiple data modelling techniques e.g. cluster analysis, decision trees, regression and other machine learning techniquesGreat communication skills, with ability to present results and insights to colleagues including Jason, our chief exec in a clear, concise and unambiguous way. What we’ll give you As well as a competitive salary, you’ll get a benefits package which includes things like a pension, life assurance, gym discounts, summer BBQs on our roof terrace, regular office food and drinks, and free fruit all week! We also take our corporate social responsibility pretty seriously and we believe in giving back to our community, so you’ll get the chance to be involved in lots of fundraising events throughout the year.  Hastings Direct, Data AnalystAre you commercially and analytically minded and looking to play a fundamental role in an exciting and evolving product?The Telematics team (based in our Bexhill HQ) is a forward-thinking team looking to revolutionize and shape the way we look at insurance in the future. This exciting new role would place you in the heart of the analytical & pricing team where you can influence  and drive strategic initiatives central to achieving our group objectives.A STEM degree and experience is advantageous but, if you have strong baseline skills in software such as Excel and a keen desire to learn, the supportive Telematics team will invest in your development. You will learn from the experts and be able to carve out  your career in a role that will give you exposure to some key senior partners and departments crucial to the success of our business.The RoleThe purpose of this role is to act as the key point of contact for the Telematics team to complete analysis in a variety of areas to inform both commercial and customer outcomes using key analysis.Your remit will include the following;  Building and delivering robust MI and BI reporting to provide oversight to key stakeholders to support trading and business decisions, with a view of identifying key trends, spotting trading anomalies and working with the data analytics & pricing manager  to take action to support performanceKey point of contact for technical, data and analytical requests to support wider business functions in achieving the wider group's objectivesEnd-to-end responsibility for the implementation and testing of retail pricing changes and practices, providing detailed impact analysis for company and customerConduct ad hoc analysis, creating & testing various hypotheses raised by the teamOwnership of key business processes ensuring delivery within agreed timeframes, with an eye to improve the team's productivity via automated solutions Required experience  Highly analytical; able to clean, scrutinize and interrogate high volumes of complex data and translate into meaningful reports, insights and high level management informationHave a passion for data quality and integrity, cleansing and querying data from structured databasesAdvanced skills in the use of MS office applicationsGood communication and presentation skills (both verbal and written)Keen eye for detailPro-active approach to driving changeConfidence to express opinions and challenge othersEducated to A level in a numerical field (minimum) Desirable  Advantageous to have a BSc/MSc in Statistics / Computer Science / Physics / Operational Research / Engineering / Maths or other quantitative fieldExperience working with analytical, statistical & data manipulation packages (e.g. SQL, R, Python etc.)Strong knowledge of Insurance market & competitorsProven research skills, including ability to formulate hypotheses and identify ways to prove or disprove these with targeted testsExperience delivering commercial targets Personal attributes  As a growing business, your role can really help make an impact on both the development and delivery of this function - it will be exciting, busy, varied and challenging so a roll sleeves up, hands-on approach is an absolute must.Natural problem solver who communicates effectively to all stakeholders.This is a dynamic, fast paced working environment - candidates should be comfortable working within that setting and demonstrate a proactive working style.Great attention to detail - systematic approach to managing your workload.Embraces opportunities to develop and learn - shows a great level of self-awareness and drive. Benefits for youPlease find some of the great benefits we offer here at Hastings Direct;  Competitive basic salary which we will share with you upon shortlisting, but do feel free to email the Recruitment team for more details in advance of your application - Flexible working opportunities working 1-2 days a week from homeUp to 5% bonus earning potential25 days holidayCompetitive pensionFlexible benefits - buy or sell holidays, opt in dental and healthcare cash plansDiscounted Hastings Direct productsA test and learn culture Hastings Group is an equal opportunities employer which means we treat people fairly. We welcome applications from all suitably skilled persons regardless of their gender, age, race, disability, ethnic background, religion/belief, sexual orientation, gender  reassignment or marital/family status. Please also note that we have a thorough referencing process, which includes credit and criminal record checks.

 My client a fantastic magazine publisher with a great array of interesting and exciting titles across beauty, fashion and fitness are looking for a Junior Data Analyst. Your skills will include SQL, working with large data sets and be able to take complex data and present in layman terms, working on pivot tables you will also have strong Excel experience. update CPAs and work closely with the acquisitions team on cost managementLIFETIME VALUE: Obsess over customer lifetime value to ensure the customer price journey is continuously optimised• Identify customer segments for price and offer targeting• Assist in the development of subscription packages to drive revenue growth• Determine renewals pricing and optimise the renewals series to grow year 2+ revenue and drive down costsABOUT YOU:• Strong analytical skills• Proficient Excel skills• Experience working within a subscription marketing team• Commercially minded• Excellent attention to detail• Strong presentation skills• Good at building and maintaining internal and external relationships• Strong team player• Enjoys developing and working to clear strategic targets• Thrives under pressure• A professional and mature approach to business• Collaborative Please contact me if you want to take advantage of this fantastic opportunity. *Due to the high volume of responses, if you have not received an email in 48 hours please take it that you have unfortunately not been successful.

body:
£70,000 - £80,000 per annum















North West London



, London




Permanent, full-time







                        Apply on employer's website
                    


We are: A global customer generation business, supplying some of the world’s leading global brands with high volumes of new customers. We’re on a mission to accelerate our clients’ growth through a passion for data, relentless innovation and the development of world-class  teams - and we want you to join us! We believe that people are our greatest strength, and are lucky enough to have a world-class team of 450+ MVFers building our remarkable culture and driving growth for our clients, primarily in the UK and US - and we’ll soon be launching our third office,  this time in the APAC region. We believe in working smarter, not harder. People join us to develop their careers, work with top talent - and transform the industry. We’ve grown rapidly and consistently over the last ten years, topping the Sunday Times Tech Track in 2013. We weren’t happy  with 6th place in the Sunday Times Best Companies 2017 - so we made 2nd place in the Sunday Times Best Companies 2018!  You are: A Lead Analyst to lead our vital and growing Analytics team. You will help set the long-term vision and strategy for data-driven decision making in the company and through your team, deliver the datasets, models and analysis MVF relies on to drive our extraordinary  growth. Reporting into our CTO and working closely with functional leads and Product Managers across the business, you will drive a roadmap that unlocks greater performance and insight from our data. You’ll ensure that the data is reliable and up-to-date, and accessible  through Explores and Dashboards. Then, you’ll increase the level of Analysis within the Analytics team, and across the business. The Analytics team consists of four Analysts reporting directly into you, plus a variety of Data-Spokes and Data-Champions who through a connection to the team can deliver innovations to data models and help drive the adoption and roll-out of new functionality.  You’ll also be supported by the Data Engineering Team who deliver infrastructure and ETL as required. Coming into a new role, you will be self-sufficient and confident in managing the various demands of the function, however you’ll find the team and the wider business very supportive and willing to invest time in setting you up to succeed. The breadth of  the role, and the autonomy it affords, makes this an exciting opportunity for someone with energy and initiative, wanting to step up into a management position. Your role:  Best practice rock-solid datasets: Using world-class technology to provide analysis and BI reporting to MVF. Automating data governance, glossary and testing where possible.High performance: Queries and models optimised for speed. Costs associated with ingestion and compute forecasted. Advanced analytics: Coach and lead the team in providing insights and analysis using statistical methods, significance testing, regression and other modelling techniques. Measurement and KPIs: Partner with senior leaders, Strategy Team and Product Managers to improve KPIs and metrics of our business and strategies.Build and manage our Analytics team - help to develop a high-performance culture in which your analysts, Data-Spokes and Data-Champions can thrive MVF Data University: Deliver Analysis and BI training through others, so that all MVF teams are confident and competent in their use of data in the execution of their role.Team development: Oversee the development of a competency model, progression framework, onboarding and training materials for the Analytics team. Identify external training and work with the L&D team to create a programme to upskill Analysts.Stakeholder relationships: Delight CxOs and stakeholders across Marketing, Product, Strategy, Sales, Finance and Technology; Serve as strategic advisor and enabler across the organization to achieve departmental objectives.Become a subject matter expert in the business logic of our platform; help to drive Product roadmaps to improve our systems and our business model. Your skills and experience:  You have strong a understanding of what drives business value with a proven ability to identify opportunities and pursue them to realizationYou are knowledgeable about, and interested in the tools and technologies available to BI and how these can be best used in agile environmentsYou are keen to work with our current toolset (Looker, DBT, Snowflake)You’re an outstanding communicator and presenter: whether complex, data-driven topics to senior leaders, or sharing the latest news with the teamYou have a track record of effectively managing and coaching as a hands-on practitioner-manager.You have a track record of influencing people and changing behaviours; acting as a role model in the business and setting high standards for yourself and othersYou have project management and service delivery experience, being able to manage and communicate priorities effectively to meet the needs of wider stakeholders.You’re comfortable with operating in cross-functional, agile teams. Must haves:  5+ years’ experience in analysis and reportingSolid hands-on knowledge of SQLKimball dimensional modelling Bonus points for...  PhD or advanced degree in Statistics, Mathematics or a scientific fieldExperience with hypothesis testing and statistical modellingExperience or knowledge of Operations Research and optimisationExperience of managing analysts and/or data engineers and owning the BI strategy for a business unit or small enterpriseExperience developing and coaching direct reports and identifying training needs for individualsExperience with performance marketingLooker, Snowflake, DBT or similar What we offer:  Individual training budget to spend on your professional development1 day per week work-from-home policy10% time to work on personal projects you feel might benefit MVF mostUnlimited book allowanceYour choice of hardwareHuge range of sports and culture clubsFree healthy breakfast!

Having recently received a large investment from a well known mass media company, they are looking to expand and grow their reach internationally. Joining their growing analytical team, you'll be responsible for providing data driven insight to help understand where their content is hitting the mark and finding out what makes their audiences tick. Ideally you'll come from a strong data driven background and will have had exposure to data analysis from social media platforms. You'll need strong statistical knowledge and analytical skills to be able to collect, organise and analyse large datasets. You  also visualise this data using various BI tools such as Power BI, Tableau or Google Data Studio. Creating models to derive new insight from existing data, you'll work alongside their agile development team to ensure data is delivered in a coherent and timely fashion, automating processes where possible. Need to have:  Experience with BI tools such as Power BI or TableauThe ability to automate as much of the job as you can.Experience writing SQL queriesBigQuery, Google Analytics or No-SQL Database experience Nice to have (but not essential!)  Python, R or Matlab This is company has an exiting future and this is a brilliant time to be jumping on board. If you're looking for a role that offers a competitive salary and excellent benefits, hit apply for immediate consideration.
